title: How can anyone earn money without having any skills? - Quora

response.answer_text: It isn’t easy to make good money with no skills. Because skills are so broad. That includes anything from business schools (marketing, sales, strategy) to money-management skills (budgeting and investing) through to 1,001 other things including technical skills like engineering. In reality, most people have skills. Some are highly-skilled. Some low-skilled. Some in the middle. However, I will make one point. A middle-skilled person, can beat a highly skilled person in some situations. The reason is simple; the market doesn’t give a damn about fairness. Look at it like this. A doctor is one of the most highly skilled jobs;  Some are paid very well. Especially the experienced ones. In many countries though, doctors aren’t paid well. Even in rich countries, most doctors aren’t paid well until 40+. Junior doctors aren’t paid well. Nurses much worse. Many sales and marketing people earn more, many small business owners producing what many would see as crap products, are earning more. Is that fair? Probably not, but the market doesn’t care about how high a skill is worth. Just 30–50 years ago footballers were not paid much money. Now the very top ones (top 1–3) can make up to $100M+ a year. Again the market cares about supply and demand, not fairness. So if you can create a service that is considered useful, even if it isn’t highly skilled, you can do well. Just look at people like `InstaGram influencers`. They can make loads and produce nothing of value for most people. Some reading 52 finance tips9 things stopping people from achieving successWhere are the 120,000+ billionaires?What does Agassi’s autobiography tell us about success?

A few ways actually SeniorityBasically work at a place long enough that you get promoted or advance based off your tenure with the company. This happens through call centres, many retail (grocery and otherwise) have systems like this in place. This will get you paid and also into a management position which is nice for the ego and the pay. Hours workedSo your take home is your hourly rate x your hours worked. So to make more you need to increase one or the other. Work your normally day job and take on as much overtime as you can if that gets you into a better pay situation or can help you advance or any extra benefits that can come from this. Alternatively to that work a second job. I worked 2 jobs for about 9 years so its very possible, diversifies your income for safety and if you work in a bar/club etc, then you actually save more cause you can’t go out those nights and spend money. Talent definedThis is quite an odd question as your basically saying “I am not good at anything, what can I do?” Well you can get good at something. No body is entirely useless at everything. Numbers can baffle some people but they are good with there hands. Some people are bad with there hands but like using and working with computers. Find an area of interest and see what careers can be built around this interest. Cheer up! :) Do the jobs no body wants to doCleaning, etc isn’t a job anyone aspires to or is delighted to do. You can however work as a cleaner and clean a space spotless and take pride in this success. You can then use this work completed successfully to get recommendations for other places, etc. and try to build a company in an area people don’t want to be. OpportunityEveryone at some point has opportunity present itself. Prepare yourself as best you can for it by being as educated as you can, having a savings fund to help you capture these chances. Its all good, relax. Hourly rate x hours worked = Money … So maximise both as much as you can. Don’t move job too often and make sure you break your balls.

Thanks for your question. I don’t know you, but I can assure you have some kind of talent, you might just don’t realize it. Actually, there is a lot of people without talent making money. If you ask me, I am in the Internet/affiliate marketing niche and there is way more talented people than me… I am not the most talented but I am persistant. Tell me, are you persistant? stubborn (in a good way)? Those things will become a necessity when trying any type of venture. If you just stick to it (it might sound cliche) and refuse to quit you will make it. It might not always be so easy, but that is the truth. Of course, having someone who can help you and guide could of course help you accelerate the process. That being said, there is plenty of ways you could make money. The question might be, how? would you like to start an online business? offline? A combination of both? If you don’t currently have a talent, could you learn a skill? For example, it could be Graphic design and then you could offer your services on Freelancer - Hire & Find Jobs or Upwork, the world's largest online workplace. Here is a pic of freelancer:  And here is a pic of how the Upwork site looks like:  If you are interested in doing microjobs you could take a test at WorkMarket, an ADP Company: #1 Freelance Management System and become a transcriptionst. From my personal experience you might be able to earn around $4 - $7 dollars per hour. The site looks like this:  Another site could be http://transcribme.com  Other type of ventures could be to start an online business either as a product creator of affiliate for a digital/physical product(s). Here is a post I made related to affiliate marketing: Robin A. Palmer's answer to How do I make money online? For more info on how start generating an income online please consider visiting my Youtube channel and the following video: Robin Palmer Marketing  Warm regards, Robin

If You Want To Create Money Without Skills,Check Out The Listings Below. 5 Ways To Earn Money Online Without Skills 1.Become a Data Entry Operator Data entry jobs are simple and easy for beginners to start a career in. As a data entry operator, you might be expected to do a number of tasks which might include typing a set of data into a spreadsheet, transcribing pdf or image files into Microsoft Word. The scope of work for data operators are endless.you will find better opportunities that can pay anywhere from $10 and more. 2.Fill Up Online Surveys Businesses, researchers, and government agencies use surveys to understand their customers and constituents better. This often requires acquiring real-time survey results very fast. That’s where survey sites come in.You can register yourself as a survey taker and earn anywhere from$1-$3 per form from these websites.Survey Sites Include Swagbucks,Google Opinion Rewards,etc. 3.Work as a Customer Service Assistant As E-commerce grows at an unprecedented rate, especially during this lockdown, buyers are eager to learn more about the businesses they deal with before making a purchase. This means that there is more room for customer query managers who can answer questions timely and generate sales with excellent customer service. 4.Copy Trading The idea behind copy trading is simple. Instead of picking your own stocks and assets to place your investments in, use social trader tools to find expert traders whose trade you can copy. So if an expert you chose allocates 1% of his investment in an Apple stock, you’d also have 1% of your investment directed towards the same stock. 5.Test websites Web designers design websites for general people like you and me and want to ensure that everyone is comfortable with the website. Also, thanks to advanced testing tools, designers can also study your behavior to find out how they can maximize clicks (and sales) by changing certain elements with in the website. So it is only natural that companies and designers pay their target audience to test out their website. Thanks For Reading Hope It Helped You

First of all, just about everybody has something to offer, and I’m almost certain you have skills. You typed this question on Quora, right? Well, clearly you can use a computer or smart device, which means you have access to resources available to market yourself, improve or enhance your skill sets, study and learn new things, and discover opportunities. Start by finding out what you truly want in life, juxtapose that with your passions and interests, and determine how you can align these values. For example, I want to earn sustainable wealth that will enable me to provide for my family today and tomorrow. I want to leave my children and their progeny with security and peace of mind when I’m gone. I enjoy cooking, writing, making videos, offering advice, and searching for areas in the market I can exploit. So, I eventually opened a food cart in my community (the first of its kind) and provided my own food delivery service. I recognized a need for something in my community, connected my passion for cooking with the skills I have in marketing, and provided a service that enabled me to capitalize on the opportunity. There are literally a million things that you can do to earn money. You just have to find what drives you and where there is a need in the market (or where you can create that need). Invest in yourself by improving what you have to offer. This doesn’t have to be accomplished through formal education; continue doing what you’re doing right now: inquiring on social media, utilizing online learning resources like Kahn Academy, YouTube, and Quora. You began with a very broad question, now begin to narrow your scope and inquire about specifics in your areas of interest.

By becoming the middleman. In a nutshell, you simply connect a buyer who require a particular service to someone who can provide that service, and then you pocket the difference. You don’t need any skills to deliver that service, because you’ve found a vendor who will do that job for you. Okay, maybe you’ll still need a bit of soft skills to co-ordinate with your vendor to enure smooth delivery for the customer. But that’s just the bare minimum that you need to make this work. We are not talking about rocket science here. Here’s an example. Let’s say you want to set up a Fiverr gig selling SEO services, but you know nuts about SEO. What do you do? You simply hire a cheaper vendor from SEO Clerk to do the job for you. So every time your gig receives an order, you simply pass the job over to your vendor at SEO Clerk to deliver the service. You earn your keep as a middleman just like that. Come end of the day, you still know nothing about SEO. There are also many resourceful tools out there that will help you perform a job without the need to hire a vendor. Proofreading is a good example. Do you need to be perfect in English in order to be a good proofreader? Of course not. Because you have a jolly good friend in Google Docs to help you out! Simply copy and paste onto the Google Docs, and let it go to work by helping you find the grammatical errors and then correcting them. Of course, you’ll need a skill here. But we are talking about how to use a Word document here. You should know how to use it, right? I hope my answer has opened up a few possibilities for you. All the best! Kaizen Discover how you can make money online the easy way by visiting my Quora profile here

Here’s a short list to help you get started: 1. BookScouter Here’s one perfect for students or avid readers! BookScouter is a website that allows you to sell your used books and textbooks to the highest paying site. Simply enter the ISBN number of any book and you’ll instantly be shown a list of different prices from about 40 book buyback sites. Choose the one that pays the most and sell your book to them. Textbooks and school-related books often cost a ton of money and you only use them a couple times in your entire life! Why not sell your textbooks to pad your pocket a little bit? While there are tons of website available to sell used books, personally I think BookScouter is the best. All you have to do is locate the ISBN number of the book, and the website will search over 40 different buyer sites to locate the ones that will pay the best price for your used book. 2. Ebates You might have seen this one in a TV commercial! Ebates is slowly becoming one of the biggest cashback sites. Basically, you earn a certain percentage cash back if you shop through them. They have almost any online store you can think of. From Amazon and Walmart to Best Buy, Target, and much more. So if you shop online, I think it’d be crazy not to use a cash back shopping site like Ebates. It’s like getting free money for buying something you were going to buy anyway. Don’t forget to check out their Double Store for double cashback on purchases made through qualifying stores. 3. Microsoft Rewards You search online, don’t you? We all do. Perhaps even multiple times a day. Need Extra Cash for Free? If you like getting paid for surveys, and are going to join only one site, I would recommend you choose Ipsos-iSay. Ipsos is the most fun and well-paying panel. Give it a try to see how you like it. It is free anyway! Click to Join Ipsos Now! Well, now you can earn free gift cards just for doing that! Sign up with BingRewards for free, then search as you normally would. For every search you perform, you earn a certain number of points. Once you have enough points, you can redeem for gift cards, meal discounts, and even airline points. I’d venture to say an average searcher could easily earn an extra $100 a year using BingRewards. 3. FatWallet FatWallet is one of the oldest cashback sites offering some of the highest cashback percentages on some of these stores. For example, you can earn up to 4% cash back for shopping through eBay, up to 6% through Groupon, or even as much as 27% through Angie’s List! 4. InboxDollars InboxDollars is what you would call a total rewards site where you earn rewards for pretty much everything you can do online, anything from shopping and visiting websites, to taking surveys, playing games, watching videos, and more. Here are some of the kind of offers you can complete to get some quick cash: Playing games: You can earn up to 10% back when you purchase token packs and boosters for some of your favorite games. Play for free!Taking surveys: You will also have the chance to play BillyÕs Spin and Winwhich lets you earn survey tokens and sweepstakes entries!Using search engines: Earn cash by using InboxDollars’ custom search engine.Watching videos: Or completing fun interactive activities.Shopping: Earn cash back on all sorts of purchases when you shop online through InboxDollars’ partners!And that’s not all. They constantly add new earning options. Plus, they offer sign up bonus as well. Sign up today and get a $5 sign up bonus. 5. UserTesting What could be easier than visiting a website and then telling the site owner what you think of their site! And the amazing part is that you get paid for testing websites. They do this so they can test the functionality and user-friendliness of their website. Create A Better Customer Experience | UserTesting is a site where websites owners and everyday people, like you and I, are brought together to help each other. The site owners get his/her site tested by real people, and you get paid for doing what you already do dozens of times every day. How much money can you make, you ask? Different user testing sites have varying rates, but Create A Better Customer Experience | UserTesting pays a flat rate of $10 for every site you test. 6. Swagbucks Who hasn’t heard of Swagbucks by now! Just in case you haven’t, SB is one of the most famous online rewards sites. So famous that they have even been featured on many media outlets such as ABC’s Good Morning America show, and even Forbes. Like InboxDollars, SB will pay you to visit the website of their sponsors and participate in activities like shopping, surveys, and more! They use their own form of currency, called Swag bucks, which can be converted into real cash. You can even download their app for your Android or Apple devices. Here are some of the ways you can generate some extra earnings with Swagbucks: Signing up for the website: You’ll earn a certain number (this number changes from time to time) of Swag Bucks just for joining.Swagbucks VISA Rewards Credit Card:Earn 1.25 Swag Bucks per Dollar on every purchase. You’ll earn an additional 1,000 Swag Bucks after your first purchase (within the first 3 billing cycles). Plus, if you spend $1,000 or more within the first 6 billing cycles, you’ll get another 2,500 Swag Bucks!Watch videos: Choose from a variety of different video topics and you could earn up to 150 Swag Bucks a day.Search: Instead of using your regular search engine, use Swagbucks’ to generate a small profit.Play games: Earn Swag Bucks for playing cash games.Shop online: Use their portal to earn Swag Bucks per every dollar you spend at popular online retailers like Amazon or Travelocity. Plus, you’ll get awesome discounts, like 15% off any order at JCPenny on top of the Swag Bucks you earn!Take Surveys: Earn up to 60 Swag Bucks per day!And that’s not all. The site adds new ways to earn more SB’s all the time. And as far as getting paid goes, you have good options. You can redeem your earnings for cash (PayPal) or gift cards from almost any online and real brick & mortar store you can imagine. 7. Mr. Rebates Another cashback site. This one gives you $5 just for signing up, which is free of course. They have a low $10 minim threshold for cashing out. They send you a check every time you hit that $10 mark. You can also refer your friends and family to the site and earn from their earnings as well. You get 20% of your referral’s earnings. 8. Ibotta Not all purchases are made at department stores or auction sites. In fact, the majority of our shopping is related to food and grocery items. This is where Ibotta shines; it gives you cashback for your everyday purchases, like when you buy eggs or bread! Not to mention it gives you $5 for every friend you refer to the site who redeems any rebate. Who wouldn’t want to get paid for scanning their grocery receipts? 9. Upromise This is perfect for new moms, or parents who are trying to save for their children’s college fund! With Upromise (review here) you can earn cash back through over 850 popular online shopping partners, and then the money generated is deposited into a college savings service! You can earn 5-10% cash back by shopping with Sears, Groupon, Staples, Macy’s, and more! Up to 8% can be earned at over 10,000 participating restaurants. You can even earn 5% cash back when booking travel through an approved sponsor! They also offer the Upromise MasterCard, which gives you an extra 5% cash back at online shops, restaurants, and approved travel agencies plus an extra 2% on department store purchases and up to 1% on everything else! College is expensive, but with Upromise, you can put money away for a college fund while shopping at all your favorite online retailers! 10. Gomez PEER This one is as easy as it gets, although some of us may take issue with the privacy situation. Here is how it works… Install their free app on your computer and go about your day! That really is it! It basically leverages your system’s idle resources (such as unused processing power, RAM, and bandwidth) to test the performance of many of the world’s most popular websites. What’s in it for you? For every month you keep the app installed, you earn cash which is paid to you via PayPal. And just how much you earn depends on how much idle resources were used from your PC. It’s not much money, probably a few dollars a month or even less. But then again, you are not really doing anything. You’re just letting them use your PC’s unused resources. Basically, you get paid to turn your computer on. Takeaway As you can see, it doesn’t take any special skill or know-how to make some side money with these sites. Sure, none of these are going to help you quit your day job, but they allow you to earn a few extra dollars mostly for things that you already do online. And best of all, none of these money making ideas and options require any special skills

There is no such a thing as no skills. There is laziness though and that affects the individuals from exploring their skills. Keep in mind that there are classic set of skills obtained usually through school/training but you should not limit yourself to these. I think the most important skills are the natural set of skills that you are born with. As an example, some people are natural born salespeople. I know a guy that did not finish 5th grade but can talk you in to buy whatever he is selling. Another example is these motivational speakers … they don’t know how to do anything but they know how to talk about things in a way that they make you do things. My personal opinion, you can be successful without learned skills if you know how to explore your natural skills, and you could do great if you are able to combine both.

You could try: Getting a Job I learned a lot about money from working a minimum wage job. Just soak up knowledge from the people around you. Be humble. Most millionaires are made by saving a large percentage of their income—and this takes time. Almost 60 years on average! Earning Passive Income This category would be more aptly named low-effort income. It’s rare to literally make money by putting in no effort. To learn more, check out Nat Eliason’s guide. You could spend a year creating something that employs other people and has a ton of growth potential, or you could spend a year making something that kicks off $5,000 a month. Just keep in that mind that basically nobody makes a living this way, and you may be happier working on a career. Freelance Ask your relatives and friends if they need any work done. Do the work. Then, scale the business. You’ll probably learn a lot in the process. In summary, I recommend that you go out and put in action. Don’t sit around reading guides about investing in bitcoin or whatever. I write more stuff on my website: Matthew Parris

If a person thinks that they have no talent, I’d recommend to spend some quality time with themselves to discourse. Everyone surely will have some talent. If still no, then one may have to spend time and money to acquire a skill and talent. But earning “decent amount of money” with no talent or special skill, I don’t think so.

Learn and build skills that you need and know that they can be used to make ton of money. You are a blank slate, given enough time, you can achieve a decent skill above average Joe. Mastery and VIRTUOSITY is another story, as you may need few years of dedicated practice for the first and 10–20 years of dedicated practice for the second. Still, 6–18 months of focused training can get you easily above average. Start with something simple. How to learn fast, for example. Learn different techniques and keep practising them for one-two years. Then your main skill will be that you can learn very fast, you cut any future time period needed for the next skills to learn at least by half. Actually, i would learn to read fast before that, as this will make me to read faster, saving more time added to the next projects. After this, just choose something that you like or it is very useful. keep in mind, master plumbers or master locksmiths make more money that a doctor, and need like 10 times less training to achieve that.
